windows.symptom: Error message popping up frequently, even when no Office program is running        I've been getting an error message every 30 minutes or so with this message, even when no Microsoft Office programs are running."C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.MicrosoftOfficeHub...\LocalBridge.exeThe parameter is incorrect."I tried both the offline and online repair of Office and rebooting and the error message persists.  I can still use all Office programs as normal, but the error popping up often is very annoying and I'd like to get rid of it.[Moved from: Office / Unknown/other / Windows 10 / Office 365 Home]
solutions: Hi Cole,  Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I understand your query related to Microsoft Office error popping up on your PC screen. For further clarity on the issue, please respond to the questions below. Which build version of Windows 10 are you using currently?Are you aware of any changes made to the pc prior to which you weren’t facing this issue?Do you have Microsoft Office installed from Microsoft Store? Refer the article Which version of Windows operating system am I running? If you have Microsoft Office UWP app installed on the PC, then you can try uninstalling it and see if the error message appears again. Press Windows + I keys together to openSettings.Now click on Apps and select Apps & FeaturesSearch for Get Office app and then click on itNow click on Uninstall  In case you are facing issues in uninstalling the application, then you can use PowerShell commands to uninstall the app. Press Windows + X keys together and click onWindows PowerShell (Admin).Accept the UAC prompts, if you receive anyNow copy paste the command and hit Enter:Get-AppxPackage|? name -like MicrosoftOfficeHub|remove-appxpackageRestart the PC. In addition, if the issue persists, then you can try performing Clean Boot on the PC and check. Refer the articleHow to perform a clean boot in Windows Performing a clean boot will start the computer with minimal set of drivers and programs, to determine whether a background program is causing the issue. Some of the Startup programs will not load after performing a clean boot on the computer. However, that functionality will return when you reset the computer to start normally after finishing the troubleshooting. If the error disappears after performing Clean Boot, then you can refer the sectionHow to determine what is causing the problem after you do a clean boot from the Clean Boot article. Note: Please refer the section Reset the computer to start normally after clean boot troubleshooting to boot the computer in to normal mode after troubleshooting. Let us know how it goes. Regards,Prakhar KhareMicrosoft Community – Moderator
Hi,I checked under Apps and Features and there is no Get Office appI ran the command in PowerShell and rebooted but the error persisted.

Hi Cole,Thank you for replying, and I apologize for the delayed response.I would suggest you to try creating a new user account and see if the issue persists. Refer the articleCreate a local user or administrator account in Windows 10Let us know how it goes.Regards,Prakhar KhareMicrosoft Community – Moderator
I too am having the same issue.. It started last week and it is very annoying to have that popup keep coming up.

Hello! The error comes from the integrated "Microsoft Office Apps" (i do not mean Mircosoft Office 365 oder other versions). The mentioned "Office" is part of windows 10.There are 2 possible solutions:Solution 1: Reset the AppGo to "Settings/Apps" scroll to "Office" choose "Advanced options" und select "reset" in the upcoming dialogSolution 2: Uninstall the AppWhat helped me: Uninstall the App called "Office" (NOT "Microsoft Office 365" oder other versions)You can use the other installed Version of e.g. "Microsoft Office 365" as usual.

I have the same problem but am not running Windows 10. I search using both methods and do not find the app. The problem remains."C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.MicrosoftOfficeHub...\LocalBridge.exeIt states to make sure I've typed it correctly and the program cannot be found, so that's different than the others. The error message pops up *frequently* and is very annoying. Almost annoying enough to uninstall Office - but I need it for work.
This is the first error message. When I pull up the command prompt and paste in the command, i get this message:Please any assistance with this is appreciated. I am not running 10, I'm running 8.1.

Hi Mary. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.You can install Onedrive to Windows 7 and copy or drag your files into it's folder, then sign into it on Windows 10 (it's built in) and your files will be there to copy out into their User folders.To install OneDrive to Windows 7 go here: https://support.office.com/en-us/article/onedri...Also the Photos app is optional. Your photos should reside in the User Pictures folder under C:\Users\Your user Name. That they get loaded into Photos app is so you can manage, edit, arrange into albums if you want, even make video slideshows. See this guide:https://www.techradar.com/how-to/computing/how-...https://www.howtogeek.com/320942/how-to-use-win...For more tips on Windows 10 features type Tips in search box on task bar. Let me know if there's anything else I can help you with.

windows.symptom: Microsoft Store - Something happened on our end.  Try again later.        Every single time for the past week when I try to download an app from the store I get the error "Something happened on our end.  Try again later."  The new update did not help.  Please help me.
solutions: Hi,Thank you for posting the query on Microsoft Community.We understand how you feel about the situation. We're sorry for the trouble.I suggest you to follow the below link and check, if it helps:Method 1: Try running the Windows Store Apps troubleshooter.Refer these steps:Press      Windows key +X, select Control panelChange      the view by option on the top right to Large iconsClick      on troubleshooting and click on      the view all option on the left      panelRun      the  Windows Store apps troubleshooter             Method 2: Perform System File Check (SFC), and then check if this fixes the issue.Follow the steps:a. Press “Windows Key + Q” to open Charms Bar.b. Type “cmd” without quotes in the search box.c. On the left pane, right click on the “cmd” option and select “Run as Administrator”.d. Type ‘sfc /scannow’ without quotes and hit enter.Note: It may ask for windows installation DVD to fix and to enable SFC to make more than minor repairs. Some files saved on your computer might get deleted when fixing corrupted files.Method 3: Reset Store Cache.a) Press the “Win Logo” + “R”b) Type: WSReset.exe and press “Enter”.c) Restart the computer and check.Also, try uninstalling and reinstalling the app again.I hope this helps you. If you have any further query in future, feel free to contact us. We will be happy to help you.

windows.symptom: Windows 10 repetitive 81% update        Hello, if you wish to address me by my name, call me Jay. I seem to be having the same issue as https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/profile/54b97c70-1d11-44cb-818b-0689167928d8,and i don’t know if its fixed. I tried actually wiping it! It got stuck at 81% the 1 singular fan for the cpu got really loud and then it shut off, now its stuck in a boot loop. If you’re wondering, it is an Inspiron 3050 or i3050, they were meant to be an htpc or something to browse the web with. I always had issues with updates, i should’ve never got windows 10 in the first place, it only had 32gb ssd storage, 2gb of ram, and a 2 core 2.7 ghz processor i believe. I didn’t have any other issues other than it didn’t have much storage.. I know that someone will suggest a bootable hard drive but i am no where near a shopping center that sells a flash drive and i have stupid like memory and i forget basically everything thats important. Anyways though i have plans for it now, and i need the issue resolved asap. I already tried clearing cmos, and i can get into bios, thats about it.
solutions: Hi Jay. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.If this was a WIndows Update that wouldn't install then there are steps to fix Updates that work for most. But since you said you wiped the drive and are stuck in a boot loop I'll address that instead:How did you try wiping the drive if you don't have a flash stick or DVD to make bootable media? You can't wipe a drive without it. So you'll need to buy or borrow an 8gb+ flash drive or fresh DVD to create the bootable media, then wipe the drive by deleting all partitions during install, choose the Unallocated Space that makes, then click Next to auto-format and begin install - this makes it foolproof.Follow the gold standard Clean Install in this link which compiles the best possible Install of Windows which will stay that way as long as you stick with the tools and methods given, has zero reported problems, and is better than any amount of money could buy: http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... To create bootable Windows 10 Installation Media (on another PC if necessary) install Media Creation Tool and follow the directions in the middle of the download page here:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Insert media, boot it by powering up PC while pressing the BIOS Boot Menu Key for your PC maker given in this chart:https://www.sysnative.com/forums/hardware-tutor... If the media won't boot you may need to enter BIOS/UEFI Setup (pressing key given in chart in link above) to turn off Fast Boot or Fast Startup first.Choose the boot device as a UEFI device if offered, then on second screen choose Install Now, then Custom Install, then at the drive selection screen delete all partitions down to Unallocated Space to get it cleanest, select the Unallocated Space, click Next to let it create and format the needed partitions and start install - this makes it foolproof.There is a step to rescue your files first using the booted media if you don't have them backed up:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... You will get and keep the best possible install to the exact extent you stick with the steps, tools and methods in the linked tutorial. It's a better install than any amount of money could buy and a great learning experience that will make you the master of your PC because you will learn everything that works best and how to apply it with your own hands.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

I did this completely by accident, i discovered the “Media Creation Tool” that you mentioned, i then booted up on the usb, since also, somehow i was able to get to troubleshoot menu (i know you can also use bios).  I just followed a video and deleted all partitions and reinstalled windows. I can finally use it now! Thanks anyways though.

Jay, I've glad the same steps I took the time to write out for you fixed the problem.Let me know if there's anything else. Also when ready please mark the post which helped most as the Answer, to help others. A rating is also appreciated.

windows.symptom: I need help with everything Windows 10..everything is screwy        I am not a wiz with computers, let me state that fact first. I can not explain what exactly is wrong all I know is my computer isn't not functioning like it was before ….I know that I have 0 space left and cleaning disk doesn't help I don't know how to do stuff with my datastick Sport either I just need my computer healthy and running smoothly by this coming Monday because I am a online college student and spring term begins Monday....I NEED my laptop
solutions: Here are two suggestions:1- Bring your computer to a professional to have it made right. Your college may offer computer help to students from their own staff, or from students in a computer studies program.2- Get yourself a basic, introductory level book on how to use Windows. That was one of the best gifts I ever gave myself. Work through the book slowly, carefully and by the end of the semester you'll feel much more confident.

Hi Rachel. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.So let's start with the built-in tools that can help you free up space, following these illustrated tutorials:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/d...https://www.groovypost.com/howto/maximize-stora...https://www.pcworld.com/article/3040404/windows...Next go through and sort your files into their User folders, especially Documents, Desktop and Pictures. These folders reside at C:\Users\Your User Name.You can then move those three folders into OneDrive which will upload them to the Microsoft cloud storage, even choose Files on Demand to keep them only in the cloud with just links on the PC to download them when needed. See here to do this if you like:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/116029-turn...https://www.windowscentral.com/how-use-onedrive...You can move other User folders into OneDrive like this: http://www.dummies.com/computers/operating-syst...You can also copy files onto your flash stick by right clicking the file to Send to: the flashstick when it's plugged in. Once it's confirmed on the stick then you can delete it from the PC if you need the space.So there's a bunch of things to try. Let me know if you have any questions on any of them as I will be here to help until this case is resolved.______________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

Is there anyway I can connect with someone and have them fix it from their side ???  Thatd be great haha

Why don't you start with telling us about your computer something you haven't done so far. What brand of Computer is it? We know it has Windows 10. How much RAM does it have? What size hard drive or solid state drive is in the computer? What type of CPU (Central Processing Unit) does it have and its speed? Examples, Intel i3, i5 or i7, speed 2.40 GHz. You can find out most of this by downloading and using this,www.cpuid.com .How long have you been using a computer? Type Help in the search box next to start! Look at Tips. Also see this, https://support.microsoft.com/en-us.http://www.centon.com/usb/sport-2

Rachel, this is a forums where we come to learn how to do it ourselves. If you have any problems with the steps I gave then just ask back and I'll guide you. This is how we learn to maintain our computers.If you need additional help then on Monday you can contact Microsoft Support by one of these phone numbers:https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/405170...You can also go here: https://partner.support.services.microsoft.com/... choose the link for Browser help, interact briefly about your exact problem, keep replying agent until it connects with an agent.

With all due respect, if you're 'not a wiz' then you really don't want to try long lists of complicated procedures on your own. Have someone who is a wiz make things right.BTW, I don't know anything about your school, of course, but even if you are online only, your school may be able to help you online.

Have any of the replies helped you? If not click on Settings>Update and Security>Troubleshoot. If you don't see something that you are having a problem with then look at the top right of the page and click on,Get Help!

windows.symptom: Where can I get the current Windows 10 Insider ISO (version 2004, build 19041.1)        I have a computer on the Insider slow ring, running version 2004 build 19041.1. The computer is having significant problems and I'm trying to repair my Windows installation. https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windowsinsiderpreviewadvanced has Insider ISOs for download, but the latest version they have there is build 19035. Is there somewhere else I can get the version I actually need here? If not, is that site still being updated, and when can I expect to see a new version there?
solutions: Thst ISO (build 19035) is latest released ISO.

Hi, The latest stable build's ISO can be downloaded via the media creation tool. These might not include the latest security patches where is where the difference in build number may come from. They can still be used for running a repair though.https://www.microsoft.com/software-download/win...I hope that helps.

windows.symptom: Cancellation on purchase of affinity photos by mistake        HelloI request to please cancel the order and refund amount of $79.45 AUD ON PURCHASE affinity photos which was purchased by mistake, I was having dinner and my kid by mistake pressed buy button and purchased this app,
solutions: Hi, My name is Will i'm an independent adviser. We can't refund purchases here as this is the community forum. There is a process for requesting a refund you can follow though. To do this sign in athttps://account.microsoft.com/billing/orders/ find the order you would like to refund, if it is eligible there should be an option on the order similar to "refund information". Here you can follow the steps to request a refund for the purchase. If you cannot see the order in your history or are ineligible for a refund you may need to contact support directly.I hope that helps.

windows.symptom: LG TV not windows certified        I'm trying to link my Samsung laptop to my LG Smart TV and keep getting the message "not windows certified". Does anyone have an answer please?
solutions: How you try to link them?What is the model of your TV?Are you using cable or wireless connection?

Connect your PC to your TV through HDMI (and More) - HP ...4 Ways to Connect PC to TV - wikiHow___________________________________________How did you hook it up;  HDMI or VGA?.http://www.howtogeek.com/179392/beginner-geek-how-to-connect-a-laptop-to-a-television/Audio Connections If you are using VGA or DVI to connect your computer to a TV, you’ll have to find another way to get your audio going.  You basically have two choices: you can use external speakers that you hook up to your computer (or use the speakers built into your laptop), or you can use a separate audio cable to output the sound from your computer to the TV.DVI to HDMIYou’ll probably never see a laptop or television with a DVI port on it.  However, it’s pretty common to find them on desktop computers.  DVI uses digital signals to send video output, so it can be easily adapted to HDMI while still maintaining great quality.  The biggest drawback to using DVI instead of HDMI is that it doesn’t carry audio._______________________________________How to Connect a Laptop or Other Computer to Your TV - LifewireMaking Wireless Connections Between Computers and TVs As an alternative to cables, you can also use any of several different methods to set up wireless connections between computers and TVs:Some so-called smart TVs  support Wi-Fi.For the many televisions that do not support Wi-Fi, you can install a separate unit between the computer and TV. Wireless dongles (sometimes called "digital media receivers" or wireless PC-to-TV systems) like Google Chromecast plug into a TVs HDMI port and enable Wi-Fi.Older PCs could be installed with Windows Media Center Edition (MCE) that supports   streaming to your television in addition to receiving television on the PC viaTV tuner cards and shared across a home network via Media Center Extender product like the Linksys DMA2100.

Hi CyberDefendTeam,I want to link using wifi & miracast. Both devices support these & I can get them to talk to each other until the tv tells me it can't connect because it0is not windows certified. My tv is a LG webOS UK6540PTD. Laptop is a Samsung purchased end of 2013 running windows 8.1.Cheers,17BorderCollies

windows.symptom: Importing        Is it possible to import my files, favorites, pictures, etc. from a previous computer running Windows 7, to my current computer running Windows 10, and do it for free?
solutions: Hi ,TomDavis101 my name is Dennis, I'm an independent advisor and I'll do my best to help today. For images and other files stored on your windows 7, the easiest way to transfer them to a Windows 10 computer is through a backup on a USB drive or an external disk, creating a folder on the USB drive or external hard drive and transfer the files, after you finish on the pc with windows 10 you can restore the files again Regards, Dennis.

windows.symptom: Windows 10 installation failed...        Hello - I'm not a computer dummy, but I've spent days on this problem without any success. I upgraded two other pc's without hickup from W7 to W10... but this third one is an other matter!I'm trying an upgrade of Windows 7 Professinal with the Media Creation Tool (tried with a DVD and with an USB key as media). The upgrade runs thru the first part, displays 'Your computer is about to restart' and then simply displays 'Windows 10 installation failed'. I tried all the obvious: disconnected USB periperials, updated the BIOS (now 2016 - Asus Z97-K motherboard), updated drivers, run registry cleaners (which I mistrust deeply), run WindowsUpdate.diagcab, made a 'repair install' of W7, run all the on-board utilities like sfc and i tried to understand the log files... but I'm at my wits ends...I don't want a fresh install. This PC is loaded with programs and settings, that would be very difficult to reinstall...Any hint is appreciated! It would make it a 'happy new year' ;-)Thanks!Three log files are available here: https://1drv.ms/u/s!AsivKxnpkeEmg0mo6ufstXlOT5i-?e=o3Wzdn
solutions: @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@First thing to do is to make sure that you have the correct system requirements and that your Computer Manufacturer supplies the correct Drivers for 10 for your Model Number."Windows 10 System Requirements"https://www.thurrott.com/windows/windows-10/3884/windows-10-system-requirementshttps://www.microsoft.com/en-US/windows/windows-10-specifications#sysreqsIf you read those Microsoft's system requirements for 10, you will find that if you only go on them you will be sadly disappointed in performance.You should at least double what they say.@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Detailed information on Minimum hardware requirements:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/design/minimum/minimum-hardware-requirements-overview@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Some Manufacturers have listed Model Numberss tested with 10 at their website:ASUS - Windows 10 - Which model supports upgrade to Windows 10?Acer - Windows 10 Creators UpdateDell computers tested for Windows 10 November 2019 Update and previous versions of Windows 10 The following Gateway laptops, desktops and tablets have been tested as being suitable to install Windows 10 Creators UpdateHP Products Tested with Windows 10Lenovo devices tested for Windows 10 version 1809 (October 2018Samsung - Find out if your system runs Windows 10.Sony - What do I need to install Windows 10 on my PC?Toshiba - Models tested@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

Thank you, but I've already tried all those common place solutions. I even removed all PCIE cards e.g. - still the same result.I hope somebody with experience can look at mysetupact.logsetuperr.logsetupapi.offline.logFiles, that I posted and tell me, what the problem in MY case is.https://1drv.ms/u/s!AsivKxnpkeEmg0mo6ufstXlOT5i-?e=o3WzdnLink to my OneDrive with the log files.Thanks
That was not a solution I was offering you.I wanted you to check to see if your hardware could run Windows 10.

I checked your motherboard for you.It's fine for 10: https://www.asus.com/au/Motherboards/Z97K/HelpDesk_Download/

Hi,I looked at the logs and it indicates a plugin failure. Unfortunately log files are so complex hence a conclusion is hard to reach.2020-01-05 00:12:27, Error                 MIG    Error 0x0000007E while executing critical action Action,CMXEPlugin,C:\$WINDOWS.~BT\Sources\ReplacementManifests,Microsoft-Windows-AppX-Deployment-Server\AppxUpgradeMigrationPlugin.dll,{AE27C1A6-25F2-45FD-9A28-081B81F29E0A},Apartment.Migration will abort[gle=0x000000cb]Via https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/upgrade/resolution-proceduresCode8007042B - 0x4000DCauseThe installation failed during the second boot phase while attempting the MIGRATE_DATA operation.This issue can occur due to file system, application, or driver issues.Please try upgrading again by disabling all of the Programs/Features you do not use and try again.https://www.sevenforums.com/tutorials/5023-windows-features-turn-off.html

I disabled all the Windows features (search, indexing etc.) and I furthermore started msconfig and choose 'Diagnostic Startup' - rebooted and started the W10 setup. Result is the same. Runs up to 100% - I see 'Your PC will restart in a few moments' and then 'Windows 10 installation failed'.What I think is 'strange': the information, that Windows Media Center will be removed, appears during the setup even after I removed the Media Center from W7...I added the new Log Files (labeled B) to the others...https://1drv.ms/u/s!AsivKxnpkeEmg0mo6ufstXlOT5i-?e=h98kipThanks for any further hints!

Well... I ended doing a clean install... Deleting my Windows 7 installation and formatting the drive. I'm not sure if I found the 'original' problem, BUT... when I erased the original W7 installation and started the installation of Windows 10 it failed with the message, that W10 needs an GPT partition (in conjunction with EFI Bios) - if I understood this correctly. So I had to delete the partition and create a new GPT partition before the installation would succeed.I'm not sure, but it could be, that the upgrade installation did not work, because I needed a GPT partition...?!?! Just a hint, for somebody with the same problem... Or maybe some expert can confirm this?Sad the original upgrade installation did not provide enough information to find the problem...
